definition: sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: He refused to hold her hand though she begged.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她苦苦哀求，他也没有手下留情。

sentences.english: She implored piteously a voice choked with sobs.
sentences.chinese: 她用哽咽了的嗓音苦苦哀求。

sentences.english: Mr. Brown assigned more homework, ignoring the pleas of his students.
sentences.chinese: 不顾学生们的哀求，伯朗先生给他们更多作业。

sentences.english: When she begs you not to go, there's one thing you should know.
sentences.chinese: 当她苦苦哀求你留下，有一件事你要明白。

sentences.english: The more times you ask for help the more powerful your English will become.
sentences.chinese: 你哀求别入帮越多的忙，你的英语就会越厉害。

sentences.english: Then they cried to the Lord in anguish, and he rescued them from their distress.
sentences.chinese: 他们于急难中一哀求上主，上主即拯救他们脱离困苦。

sentences.english: Maria implored her husband to get away from the weaving car.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽娅哀求丈夫，赶紧躲开那辆还在左右蛇行的车。

sentences.english: And Samuel was angry, and he cried to the LORD all night.
sentences.chinese: 撒母耳便甚忧愁，终夜哀求耶和华。

sentences.english: Today, my boyfriend begged me not to break up with him.
sentences.chinese: 今天男朋友苦苦哀求我不要离开他。

sentences.english: He moved his lips and looked at her imploringly.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴唇动着，哀求地看着她。

sentences.english: He sat in a corner of the room canting and whining.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在房间的一个角落里一边哀求一边诉苦。

sentences.english: Samuel was troubled, and he cried out to the Lord all that night.
sentences.chinese: 撒母耳便甚忧愁，终夜哀求耶和华。

sentences.english: Please, she pleads into the phone as she seeks help for her sick child.
sentences.chinese: 她在电话上哀求着，想为自己生病的孩子求得帮助。

sentences.english: Genuine woman begging her boyfriend not to go.
sentences.chinese: 正牌女人苦苦哀求男友不要离去。

sentences.english: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
sentences.chinese: 塞耳不听穷人哀求的，他将来呼吁也不蒙应允。

sentences.english: They returned after hearing Emanuel's voice pleading for them to return.
sentences.chinese: 直到他们听到伊曼纽尔苦苦的哀求声才回来。

definition: to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
to shed tears while recounting sth/speaking in a tearful voice
to seek for/to hope to gain/desirous
